# install packages
ipak <- function(pkg){
  new.pkg <- pkg[!(pkg %in% installed.packages()[, "Package"])]
  if(length(new.pkg)) install.packages(new.pkg, dependencies = TRUE)
  sapply(pkg, require, character.only = TRUE)
}

packages <- c("tidyverse", "tuneR", "signal", "seewave")
ipak(packages)

# highpass filter

```{r}

w1 <- sine(440, duration = 0.5, xunit = "time")
w2 <- sine(1000, duration = 0.5, xunit = "time")

# combine
w11 <- prepComb(w1, where = "end")
w22 <- prepComb(w2, where = "start")
combWave <- bind(w11, w22)
listen(combWave)


#combWave <- Wave(rnorm(44100 / 2), samp.rate = 44100, bit = 16)

spectro(combWave)


# highpass filter Removes waves below a threshold
nyqFreq = combWave@samp.rate / 2

# 100 Hz is X * nyqFreq

# W is % of nyquist frequency
# for example 0.5 means a frequency of 22050 / 2 cutoff, since 22050
# is the nyquist frequency
HzCutoff = 700


bf = signal::butter(10, W = HzCutoff / nyqFreq, type = "high")
b1 <- signal::filtfilt(bf, combWave@left)
dev.off()
spectro(b1, f = w11@samp.rate)

listen(b1, f = combWave@samp.rate)

dev.off()
spec(combWave)

spec(b1, f = combWave@samp.rate)
abline(v = 0.7, col = "red")
```


```{r}
# define sound
wavFle = file.path(dataDir, "Protandrena906 copy.wav")


# load sound
w1 <- readWave(wavFle)

# view oscillogram chunks for each channel (left and right)
tryCatch(oscillo(w1@right, f = w1@samp.rate), error = function(e) NA)
tryCatch(oscillo(w1@left, f = w1@samp.rate), error = function(e) NA)


# listen to sound (plays in only one headphone, by default)
listen(w1)

w2 <- w1@left
sampRate = w1@samp.rate

# high-pass with a 100 Hz cutoff frequency
res <- bwfilter(w2, n=5, f = sampRate,from = 100, output = "Wave")

# view fundamental frequency over time: 
# with 50% overlap between successive sliding windows, time zoom and 
# amplitude filter (threshold)
# overlaid on a spectrogram
spectro(res,f=sampRate,ovlp=75,zp=16,scale=FALSE,palette=reverse.gray.colors.2)
par(new=TRUE)
fund(res,f=sampRate,fmax=1000,type="p",pch=24,ann=FALSE,
     xaxs="i",yaxs="i",col="black",bg="red",threshold=6)

```

  w1 <- mono(w1, "left")
}


w2 <- w1@left


sampRate = w1@samp.rate
#w2 <- sine(450, samp.rate = sampRate, duration = 2, xunit = "time")
#oscillo(w2)


p = tuneR::periodogram(w1, width = 1024)
plot(p)

ff1 <- FF(p)
plot(ff1)

spp <- spec(w2*2, f = sampRate, scaled = TRUE, fftw = TRUE, PSD = FALSE, wl = 1024, main = "FFT spectrum", plot = FALSE, norm = FALSE)

spectrum = data.frame(unlist(spp))

linearSpectrum = spectrum

xx <- c(linearSpectrum$x * 1000, rev(linearSpectrum$x * 1000)) #  # convert from kHz to Hz
# calculate dB, with 0 being the max
dB = linearSpectrum$y
yy <- c(rep(min(dB), length(dB)), rev(dB))

plot(xx[xx > 99], yy[xx > 99], type = 'l', ylab = "Absolute amplitude", xlab = "Frequency (Hz)", bty = "n", log = "x", cex.lab=1.1, xlim = c(100, 22050))
polygon(x = xx, y = yy, col='black', border=NA)
abline(h = c(4,2,1), lty = 2)


# high-pass with a 100 Hz cutoff frequency
res <- bwfilter(w2, n=5, f = sampRate, from = 20, output = "Wave")
res = w2
#oscillo(res)

# view fundamental frequency over time: 
# with 50% overlap between successive sliding windows, time zoom and 
# amplitude filter (threshold)
# overlaid on a spectrogram
spectro(res, f=sampRate,ovlp=0,wl = 2**11, 
        scale=FALSE,
        palette=reverse.gray.colors.2, flim = c(0, 1), osc = TRUE)

mtext(text = basename(wavFle), side = 3)
par(new=TRUE)
p = periodogram(res, width = 2**11)
ff1 <- FF(p)
points(x = seq(0, length(res@left) / res@samp.rate, 
               length.out = length(ff1)), 
       y = ff1 / 1000, 
       col = "red")
